46.text: The Yanmar SV 26is a small excavator

49.text:
and it weighs under three tonnes.  It is usually used
on small landscaping and roadworks jobs.

55.text:
This model is in the larger 1:32
scale

58.text:
and it comes in a Yanmar branded box
with a nice photo of the real machine on

62.text:
But as is so often the case there's no
other information about the real machine.

66.text:
Inside the box the model is contained
between a pair of plastic formers

70.text:
and they are held together by poppers
which are satisfying to pull apart.

74.text:
There's no assembly to do on this model
because it is complete

88.text:

92.text:
and are mounted on very simple truck
frames which don't have working rollers.

97.text:
But the drive sprocket has some detail
and at the front is a simple dozing blade.

102.text: Although the cab doesn't have wipers most of the detailing is very good

105.text:
and on the outside there are thin metal grab rails
and delicate mirrors.

109.text:
On the inside there are some very nice
controls, some graphics

135.text:
Once again we move out to the Cranes
Etc test track

139.text:
and here we see the little Yanmar
trying to get a grip on its tracks.

142.text:
They are made of rubber but they don't
roll at all easily

145.text:
and it could be that they need to be
flexed a few times to get them to roll

149.text:
Still at least they can be rotated if
you want to put the effort in.

153.text:
At the front of the machine is a small
dozing blade

156.text:
and it can be raised and lowered although
the ram that controls it is not very stiff.

161.text:
One feature on the model that's no
problem at all is rotation

165.text:
and it spins around nice and smoothly
without any rocking of the body.

169.text:
It's straight onto the excavator functions
and the boom can rotate on his pivot

173.text:
and that allows the machine to do offset
digging if it's in a tight corner.

177.text:
The movement of the boom and the stick is
good and it's been engineered well.

182.text:
There's enough stiffness in the
hydraulic rams to hold most poses

185.text:
and the range of movement is good too so
if you want you can fold the boom and stick

237.text:
The Yanmar SV26 is a nice quality model

241.text:
Certainly some of the detailing on the

245.text:
and the features of the model generally
work well enough.

248.text:
Of course in 1:32 scale you can't pose

253.text:
but if you can accept that, this is a
nice model which is highly recommended.
